alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:01AM CDT until April 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN JACKSON...WESTERN CLAY AND SOUTHEASTERN MACON COUNTIES... At 101 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Willette, or 8 miles southeast of Lafayette, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Red Boiling Springs, Boles, Moss and Whitleyville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
